hypotheses.name: Simplifying the checkout flow will reduce cart abandonment
hypotheses.description: If we reduce friction in the checkout flow, fewer users will abandon their cart at the payment step.

evidence.insight: Users drop mainly on the payment step where the form feels long and complex.

ux_observations.name: Long form fields
ux_observations.description: The payment form has 12 fields, many of which are optional but not marked as such.

best_practices.name: Single-page checkout
best_practices.description: Reduces cognitive load by showing the finish line.

experiments.name: Single-page checkout redesign
experiments.description: Consolidate the multi-step checkout into a single, streamlined page with clearer hierarchy.

component.name: Checkout form
component.description: The main checkout form including contact, shipping, billing and payment details.

evidence.insight: Shorter, single-page checkouts reduce perceived effort and increase completion.

variations.name: Single-page layout
variations.description: Merge all checkout steps into one page with a clear single-column layout.

experiments.name: Guest checkout option
experiments.description: Add a clear 'Continue as guest' option before login to reduce friction for first-time buyers.

component.name: Account step
component.description: The area where users are required to log in or create an account.

evidence.insight: Forced account creation is a known abandonment driver for first-time customers.

variations.name: Primary 'Continue as guest' button
variations.description: Show a primary 'Continue as guest' CTA next to secondary login options.

hypotheses.name: Clarifying the hero value prop will increase product exploration
hypotheses.description: If we clarify what Acme Run sells and why it matters, new visitors will more quickly understand the offering.

evidence.insight: When the hero copy clearly communicates the product and value proposition, users understand the page faster.

ux_observations.name: Vague headline
ux_observations.description: Current headline 'Run Fast' is too generic and doesn't explain the technology.

experiments.name: Strengthen hero messaging
experiments.description: Rework the hero headline and supporting copy to clearly state that Acme Run sells performance running shoes.

component.name: Hero section
component.description: The above-the-fold hero banner containing headline, subtext, imagery and main call-to-action.

evidence.insight: When the hero communicates a clear product and value message, users understand the brand faster.

variations.name: Direct product headline
variations.description: Replace the abstract hero headline with a direct product-focused statement.

variations.name: Emotional benefit headline
variations.description: Focus on the feeling of running effortlessly.

hypotheses.name: Adding expert reviews will increase trust
hypotheses.description: Displaying logos of running magazines and quotes from athletes will build credibility.

evidence.insight: Users are skeptical of new shoe brands without third-party validation.

experiments.name: Add 'As Seen In' banner
experiments.description: Insert a banner below the hero with logos from Runner's World, Men's Health, etc.

evidence.insight: Recognizable logos act as a trust heuristic.

variations.name: Grayscale logos
variations.description: Subtle, monochrome logos to not distract from the hero.

hypotheses.name: Improving size guide visibility will reduce return rate
hypotheses.description: Many users abandon PDPs because they are unsure if the shoe fits true to size.

evidence.insight: Fit is the #1 concern for online shoe buyers.

experiments.name: AI Size Recommender
experiments.description: Add a 'What's my size?' button that opens a quiz.

component.name: Size Selector
component.description: The area where users pick their shoe size.

evidence.insight: Personalized sizing recommendations significantly increase conversion.

variations.name: Quiz Modal
variations.description: A 3-step quiz asking about current shoe brands.
